title: BOJ's Kuroda warns on overseas risks, vows to conduct policy as appropriate
text:
BOJ's Kuroda warns on overseas risks, vows to conduct policy as appropriate

Economy 38 minutes ago (Sep 26, 2019 03:21AM ET)

TOKYO (Reuters) - Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said on Thursday that he would guide monetary policy appropriately without any preset conditions in mind, while warning against heightening risks from the global economy and the Chinese-U.S. trade war. Kuroda also said it was important for the central bank to stick patiently to its powerful monetary easing to maintain momentum toward achieving its 2% inflation target. "Risks are skewed to the downside, mainly from overseas economies," he said in a speech at an annual meeting for Japan's securities industry.
